page.title: 01GENERAL FEATURES
page.content: This area is an open{rural}area facing the Atlantic Ocean. The coast is rugged and the land very hilly, rising to 160 meters near Stibb.There are many valleys which are deep, steep-sided,and thickly wooded.Few trees grow near the coast which appears to be{windswept.} { }There are very few{settlements}in the area.The largest is called Stibb and is a small hamlet.Other buildings are mostly scattered farmhouses and more modern houses built especially for{retired people.}In the far south, there is part of a modern bungalow estate at Poughill. The main occupations are connected with{farming}and{tourism.}There are 2 main camping and caravan sites but many farms cater for the holiday trade as well as keeping animals and growing crops.
